section.p: As a prerequisite for using the HTTPS protocol, it is required to create an SSL certificate before installing the Service.
section.note: When installing the Service, the technical user mon-log-api will be created. This user must have read access to your SSL certificate. To provide read access for the mon-log-api user, make sure that you set the read permission to everyone for the certificate files.
section.p: Example for creating an SSL certificate:
section.codeblock: sudo su mkdir /opt/ssl cd /opt/ssl/ openssl genrsa -des3 -out server.key 2048 openssl req -new -key server.key -out server.csr cp server.key server.key.org openssl rsa -in server.key.org -out server.key openssl x509 -req -days 365 -in server.csr -signkey server.key -out server.crt chmod -R a-x,a+rwX /opt/ssl/
